contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=December 2007}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Willem Verhulst | image = | imagesize = | caption = | order = 2nd | office = Director-General of New Netherland | term_start = 1625 | term_end = 1626 | predecessor = [[Cornelis Jacobszoon May]] | successor = [[Peter Minuit]] | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = }} {{New Netherland}} '''Willem Verhulst''' was the second director of the [[Dutch West India Company]]. In 1625, Verhulst oversaw the decision to locate the company's main fortress and town on the tip of [[Manhattan]] Island in the colony of [[New Netherland]]. The settlement, which was given the name [[New Amsterdam]], was the first permanent European settlement in what was to later [[New York City]]. Verhulst was not popular with the Dutch colonists and was quickly replaced by Peter Minuit {{s-start}} {{succession box| before=[[Cornelius Mey]]| title=[[Director-General of New Netherland]]| after=[[Peter Minuit]]| years=1625—1626}} {{s-end}} ==See also== * [[Colonial America]] * [[Dutch colonization of the Americas]] * [[Dutch Empire]] * [[Fort Wilhelmus]] * [[List of colonial governors of New Jersey]] * [[List of colonial governors of New York]] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Verhulst, Willem | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Dutch colonial governor | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Verhulst, Willem}} [[Category:American people of Dutch descent]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] [[Category:Year of death unknown]] [[Category:Directors-General of New Netherland]]
